subject: Marketing
title: The Penny Press
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Penny Press.

hook.text: In 1833, the New York Sun sold papers for a penny. The trick: ads paid the real cost.

buildup.text: Before the penny press, newspapers cost six cents and catered only to the wealthy.

discovery.text: Cheap papers meant mass audiences. Mass audiences attracted advertisers. A new model was born.

twist.text: The newspaper's real customer became the advertiser, not the reader.

climax.text: This ad-supported media model persists todayâ€”from free TV to free social media.

punchline.text: If the product is free, you are the product.

quiz.question: What business model did the penny press pioneer?
options: Ad-supported media where advertisers subsidize content for readers
